result.reason: Clipboard redirection defaults to False for new RDP connections; changing ConDefaultRedirectClipboard default to True in Settings.Designer.cs and Settings.settings fixes copy/paste out of the box.
result.approach: Change DefaultSettingValueAttribute for ConDefaultRedirectClipboard from 'False' to 'True' to enable clipboard redirection by default for new RDP connections

attempts.raw_output:
Based on my analysis, the root cause is clear: `ConDefaultRedirectClipboard` defaults to `False` in `Settings.Designer.cs`. This means every new RDP connection has clipboard redirection disabled by default, causing copy/paste to silently not work. The fix is straightforward â€” change the default to `True`, which matches user expectations and matches what MSTSC (native Remote Desktop) does by default.
